messages: 7f1f8018ee6238f734df7d2512166a52 (18:02): Firetech: You still on? I've been working with Qt4 since beta 2, and I've used QPainter quite a bit in one of my personal projects (though my primary development for that has been on Mac)
5d13229461966356914982e953d45398 (18:03): I can't really see why it doesn't paint anything...
cdf4ad80dc66a41f951abab3fde0d774 (18:06): I'll try compiling it locally
cdf4ad80dc66a41f951abab3fde0d774 (18:06): Can you strip it down to a reproducible example?
5d13229461966356914982e953d45398 (18:07): well, not that many files, but it?§s a fun game ;)
cdf4ad80dc66a41f951abab3fde0d774 (18:10): Works fine on my machine.
cdf4ad80dc66a41f951abab3fde0d774 (18:10): What version of Qt do you have installed?
5d13229461966356914982e953d45398 (18:10): must be my Qt libraries then :/
cdf4ad80dc66a41f951abab3fde0d774 (18:10): 4.1.3 came out recently, so you might consider upgrading anyway.
cdf4ad80dc66a41f951abab3fde0d774 (18:11): I figured as much; ubuntu and family are the only ones I know of with 4.0.x in their package managers anymore.
cdf4ad80dc66a41f951abab3fde0d774 (18:11): It should only take half an hour or so.
5d13229461966356914982e953d45398 (18:13): I'm just a bit worried about conflicts with qt3...
d29d567972e1e13b8bd390e5395b685d (18:16): just make sure you don't clobber your old ones and your fine
cdf4ad80dc66a41f951abab3fde0d774 (18:17): I don't know if Ubuntu does like Debian and has qmake-qt3 and qmake-qt4
cdf4ad80dc66a41f951abab3fde0d774 (18:17): Might want to install it into /usr/local
5d13229461966356914982e953d45398 (18:17): the ubuntu binares have qmake-qt3 and qmake-qt4 in /usr/bin, and qmake as a symlink to one of them
b02e405e228b636cf80b3a25f5804d24 (18:17): When I insertItem many text to QComboBox how can I enforce it to resize to fit widest of inserted texts ? TIA
d29d567972e1e13b8bd390e5395b685d (18:17): by default it will install it in /usr/local/Trolltech/Qt-<version>
d29d567972e1e13b8bd390e5395b685d (18:17): nothing to worry about there
d29d567972e1e13b8bd390e5395b685d (18:18): not sure where they stick it on the mac by default
cdf4ad80dc66a41f951abab3fde0d774 (18:18): blockd: I think it's the same place.
5d13229461966356914982e953d45398 (18:19): norwegian URLs sound so pessimistic :P blablabla.no
d29d567972e1e13b8bd390e5395b685d (18:19): one of these days I'll have to get a mac notebook
5d13229461966356914982e953d45398 (18:20): blockd: I'm thinking of getting a 13" MacBook
cdf4ad80dc66a41f951abab3fde0d774 (18:20): I'm using an iBook G3. It's old but it's reliable.
b02e405e228b636cf80b3a25f5804d24 (18:20): ahigerd, I'm sorry but I forgot mention that I'm only qt3.3 :/
d29d567972e1e13b8bd390e5395b685d (18:20): I was looking at the MBP but they seem to have unresolved hardware issues
b02e405e228b636cf80b3a25f5804d24 (18:21): ahigerd, Thanks, and sorry for being imprecise
cdf4ad80dc66a41f951abab3fde0d774 (18:22): I haven't heard of any in the newer models... the older ones they fix (for free, if you're still in warranty)
d29d567972e1e13b8bd390e5395b685d (18:22): overheating issues, some sort of whining, etc
d29d567972e1e13b8bd390e5395b685d (18:22): I don't really remember the details too well
cdf4ad80dc66a41f951abab3fde0d774 (18:22): Yeah, I had a friend whose MBP did that
cdf4ad80dc66a41f951abab3fde0d774 (18:22): But they'll fix it if yours suffers from it
cdf4ad80dc66a41f951abab3fde0d774 (18:22): And the newer models don't suffer from it to my knowledge.
5d13229461966356914982e953d45398 (18:24): ahigerd: did you try the game (I sent you) itself?
cdf4ad80dc66a41f951abab3fde0d774 (18:24): And too easy to cheat >.>
cdf4ad80dc66a41f951abab3fde0d774 (18:25): Rapidly clicking can jack up your score without QPac needing to actually move anywhere.
d29d567972e1e13b8bd390e5395b685d (18:26): QPac.. sounds like some sort of pacman clone..
5d13229461966356914982e953d45398 (18:26): the score is based on the time
5d13229461966356914982e953d45398 (18:27): blockd: not really, try it yourself http://firetech.fw.nu/Cpp/Qt4/ResQPac/ResQPac-SRC.zip
d29d567972e1e13b8bd390e5395b685d (18:30): few warnings about unused params
cdf4ad80dc66a41f951abab3fde0d774 (18:31): Well, I'd recommend clearing out the uneaten dots on game over so you don't start the new game with QPac running off into danger.
cdf4ad80dc66a41f951abab3fde0d774 (18:31): I'd also consider connecting pairs of balls with lines, to make a net o' doom for poor QPac.
cdf4ad80dc66a41f951abab3fde0d774 (18:32): That'd increase the challenge while keeping it playable.
5d13229461966356914982e953d45398 (18:32): blockd: it's the events, there has to be params afaik...
d29d567972e1e13b8bd390e5395b685d (18:32): you could use Q_UNUSED in the function body
cdf4ad80dc66a41f951abab3fde0d774 (18:33): That works in the actual function definition? *blink*
d29d567972e1e13b8bd390e5395b685d (18:34): it should be valid C++, but not C though
d29d567972e1e13b8bd390e5395b685d (18:34): you don't have to comment it either of course, just makes it a little more readable I suppose
d29d567972e1e13b8bd390e5395b685d (18:35): but I like using Q_UNUSED because it's an implementation detail whether you actually use that param or not
